text: The Kad () is a river in Perm Krai, Russia, a left tributary of the Yayva.Kad River in encyclopedia of Perm Krai It is long, with a drainage basin of .Kad River in State Water Register of Russia It starts on the west slope of the Ural Mountains, to the west of Mount Cherdynsky Kamen, in Sverdlovsk Oblast. It flows into the Yayva about from its mouth. There are small tributaries, the most significant of which are Plyasovaya (10 km), Kedrovaya (11 km), Samara (11 km). == References == Category:Rivers of Perm Krai
title: Kad (river)
